title: MAG 174 - The Great Beast Transcript-converted
text:
– MAG 174 – The Great Beast 
13 
MARTIN 
All those lies you told me — you helped to do this, you turned the world into 
your, your playground. 
SIMON 
Um, not to be a pedant, but if you recall, I was actually doing a favour for 
Peter. And if Peter had won, none of this would have happened. Also, not to 
make excuses, but they weren't exactly lies. Just… oversimplifications of 
complicated truths. And guesses. 
A lot of guesses. 
Almost all guesses, really, now I come to think about it. 
MARTIN 
Shut up! I don't care. 
SIMON 
Goodness! We're rather tetchy, aren't we? 
ARCHIVIST 
We've... (slight laugh) not been having an easy journey. 
MARTIN 
John. 
ARCHIVIST 
What, it's true; we haven't. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 174 – The Great Beast 
14 
SIMON 
Well, in that case, thank you for swinging by to my, huge corner of the 
apocalypse. We don't get many visitors these days, and, well, you might be the 
closest thing the universe has ever had to an important person. 
ARCHIVIST 
Oh, I… um… 
SIMON 
I mean, obviously you're still ultimately finite and all that, but altering the very 
fabric of reality, that's... (‘phew’ whistle) That's pretty good going, all things 
considered. 
[Martin turns to the Archivist] 
MARTIN 
That's enough. John? 
ARCHIVIST 
Uh... yes? 
MARTIN 
Do it. 
[A distant thunderous boom from “Junior”] 
ARCHIVIST 
Uhh… 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 174 – The Great Beast 
15 
SIMON 
Do what? 
MARTIN 
Kill him. 
(The Archivist splutters, exhales) 
SIMON 
Ha-hang on. Can he do that? 
MARTIN 
(Firm) He can, and he's going to! 
SIMON 
(Crosstalk) Oh! Right! Um. Seems a bit rude, to be honest. Uh… 
ARCHIVIST 
(Crosstalk) erm o-okay, just... 
MARTIN 
John? 
ARCHIVIST 
(Crosstalk) J-Just give me a moment! I— 
SIMON 
(Crosstalk) I-In fact, yes! Y-you know what? I'll, I'll probably just be going, then- 
I, I- I'd prefer to keep existing, if it's all the same to you, uhm— 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 174 – The Great Beast 
16 
MARTIN 
J-John! 
ARCHIVIST 
I… 
SIMON 
(fast) Been lovely chatting to you! Good to see you both. Feel free to pop by 
again when you're feeling less, um… murdery. 
(Martin splutters while he speaks) 
MARTIN 
(yelling) John! 
SIMON 
Byeee! 
[With a whoosh and the sound of debris scattering, Simon leaves] 
(The Archivist sighs) 
MARTIN 
You let him go. 
ARCHIVIST 
(Quiet) Yeah. 
MARTIN 
Why? 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 174 – The Great Beast 
17 
ARCHIVIST 
Because, uh... uh— 
MARTIN 
(Interrupting) Why did you let him go, John? 
ARCHIVIST 
(Sharp) I don't know, I just… (sigh) I didn't want to kill him. 
MARTIN 
(Calm, becoming sarcastic) Why not? Because he was nice to you? Because he 
was charming, ‘cause he was fun? 
ARCHIVIST 
No, I, I, I just— (sighs) 
[A door creaks open] 
 [Faint hissing static and a high-pitched tone start] 
ARCHIVIST (CONT’D) 
Not now, Helen! 
HELEN 
I just wanted to add my vote to the disappointed side. 
MARTIN 
Wait, really? 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 174 – The Great Beast 
18 
HELEN 
I was rather looking forward to watching an old man metaphysically explode. 
Honestly, I feel a little bit cheated. The others were exceptional fun. 
(The Archivist sighs as she speaks) 
ARCHIVIST 
Wait, y-you were watching? 
HELEN 
(Amused) Of course. As much fun as the new world is, I am not about to miss a 
real, honest-to-godless demigod murder spree! 
(She laughs) 
(Martin sighs) 
MARTIN 
You're really not helping. 
HELEN 
(Cheerful) I'm not trying to! 
ARCHIVIST 
Look, it's none of your business. Either of you. 
[A distant thunderous boom from “Junior”] 
MARTIN 
Like hell it isn't. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 174 – The Great Beast 
19 
ARCHIVIST 
Martin. 
MARTIN 
Don't ‘Martin’ me! Sure, he looks like a harmless old man, but if— 
ARCHIVIST 
I know, Martin; I know all the things he's done. 
HELEN 
Fantastic! So, rip him up! Pop him! Oh, oh, but, um, just give me a bit of a 
heads-start so I can find a good spot. 
MARTIN 
Enough, Helen. 
HELEN 
I won't be in the way! He won't even know I'm there. Again. 
MARTIN 
What is it, John? What's wrong? 
ARCHIVIST 
I just— This whole... avenging angel thing, I, I'm not… 
It doesn't feel right.
